content.title: PSE trading delayed on Monday, traders cite technical issues - ABS-CBN News
content.desc: The bourse opened at around 10:15 a.m. Trading was scheduled to start at 9:30 a.m..

content.title: Business Nightly: Asian markets extend decline ahead of OPEC meeting - ABS CBN News
content.desc: The Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries' (OPEC) expected production cuts is also affecting local market sentiment, as Philippine shares joined the wide-scale sell-off. content.title: Unicapital Group seals partnership with KTB Securities Thailand - SunStar Philippines
content.desc: UNICAPITAL Group, one of the leading investment houses in the Philippines, signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) with KTB Securities (Thailand) Public Company Limited (KTBST) to expand market collaborations between Thai and Philippine investors in investment banking and investing in the stock market. The partnership focuses on three possible areas involving: public fund-raising transactions from institutional clients in the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) and the Stock Exchange of Thailand (SET), including equity stocks, fixed income, and mutual funds; dual-listing on the PSE and SET; ...

content.title: Traders anticipate Santa Claus rally as PH stocks surge past 7,500 - Rappler
content.desc: MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) broke past crucial resistance level and closed above 7,500 on Monday, December 3, hinting at a Santa Claus rally or a rise in stock prices in December. The PSEi closed at 7,532.9, 2.24% on Monday, 165.05 points higher than the previous close. Volume turnover was at 1.49 billion shares valued at P10.22 billion. Foreign buying was at P6.56 billion, while foreign selling hit P6.68 billion. The most active stocks were Metrobank (3.02%), Ayala Land (0.65%), SM Prime Holdings (5.19%), Aboitiz Power (4.42%), and BDO Unibank (2.3%). A...
